meanings.definition: Trembling or shaking with cold or fear.
meanings.sent1: The little puppy looked shivery in the snow.
meanings.sent2: The icy wind made me feel shivery all over.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house gave me a shivery feeling.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a shivery quality that sent chills down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie was so shivery, I couldn't sleep at night.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of coldness or fear.
meanings.sent1: The dark forest had a shivery atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The ghost story was so shivery, it made everyone jump.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected noise gave me a shivery sensation.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a shivery presence that made me uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the room was shivery and unsettling.
